item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Einstein
item.description: "Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy." -- Einstein

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "[Thine] face is not worth sunburning." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "The only thing worse than a boy who hates you: a boy that loves you." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by A.A. Milne
Eva-chan add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies." -- Aristotle

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Harriet Rubin
item.description: "Women have always been spies." -- Harriet Rubin

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Edwidge Danticat
item.description: "No, women like you don't write. They carve onion sculptures and potato statues. They sit in dark corners and braid their hair in new shapes and twists in order to control the stiffness, the unruliness, the rebelliousness." -- Edwidge Danticat

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Masashi Kishimoto
item.description: "She's strong! And scary...I bet she's single...I'd put money on it.." -- Masashi Kishimoto

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "Give a man a fish, and you'll feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish, and he'll buy a funny hat. Talk to a hungry man about fish, and you're a consultant." -- Scott Adams

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Hiromu Arakawa
item.description: "Humankind cannot gain something without first giving something in return. To obtain, something of equal value must be lost. This is Alchemy's First Law of Equivalent Exchange. In those days, we really believed that to be the world's one, and only, truth." -- Hiromu Arakawa

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Hiromu Arakawa
item.description: "Even when our eyes are closed, there's a whole world that exists outside ourselves and our dreams." -- Hiromu Arakawa

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Natsuki Takaya
item.description: "Sometimes it feels like the whole world is conspiring to destroy my house... " - Shigure Sohma" -- Natsuki Takaya

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Natsuki Takaya
item.description: "When snow melts, what does it become?' It becomes water, of course' Wrong! It becomes spring!" -- Natsuki Takaya

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Eva-chan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett
